summary:
<think>
Okay, I need to summarize this document about John S. Watson, the former Chevron CEO. Let me read through the content again to make sure I get the key points.

The document starts by stating his full name, birth date, and his role as CEO and chairman of Chevron from 2010 to 2018. Then there's a biography section. He was born in California in 1956, got a B.A. in Agricultural Economics from UC Davis in 1978 and an MBA from Chicago Booth in 1980. He joined Chevron in 1980, became CFO from 2001-2005, then Vice-chairman from 2009-2010, and then CEO and chairman from 2010 until 2018. He also has various board memberships, including the American Petroleum Institute, Caltex, Dynegy, and others.

The main topic here is John S. Watson's career, particularly his leadership roles at Chevron and his other board positions. The key concepts are his educational background, his career progression within Chevron, his tenure as CEO, and his involvement in various industry and business organizations. I need to condense this into 3-5 sentences, focusing on the main topic and key concepts. I should mention his role at Chevron, his educational background, his career path within the company, and his additional board memberships. Avoid minor details like the exact dates of his board roles unless they're crucial. Make sure it's concise and covers all the essential information without getting too detailed.
</think>

John S. Watson, born in 1956, is a prominent American businessman who served as CEO and chairman of Chevron Corporation from 2010 to 2018. He joined Chevron in 1980, progressing through roles such as CFO (2001–2005) and Vice-Chairman (2009–2010) before leading the company. With a background in agricultural economics and an MBA from the University of Chicago, Watson held leadership positions in various industry and business organizations, including the American Petroleum Institute and the Business Roundtable. His career highlights his expertise in energy sector leadership and corporate governance.

# John S. [S3] Watson (Chevron CEO)



**John S. [S4] Watson** (born October 1956) is an American businessman. [S5] He served as the chief executive officer and chairman of the board of the Chevron Corporation from January 1, 2010 to January 31, 2018. [S6] ## Biography

John S. [S7] Watson was born in California in 1956. [S8] In 1978, he graduated with a B.A. [S9] in Agricultural Economics from the University of California, Davis, and in 1980 he received an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business. [S10] In 1980, he joined the Chevron Corporation. [S11] He served as its chief financial officer from 2001 to 2005. [S12] From 2009 to 2010, he was Vice-chairman of the board. [S13] Since 2010, he has served as chairman and CEO. [S14] He also serves as chairman of the board of the American Petroleum Institute, and on the board of directors of Caltex, Dynegy (2001–2004), the National Petroleum Council, the Business Council, the Business Roundtable, JPMorgan International Council, the American Society of Corporate Executives, and the Animal Rescue Foundation.
